title: Gavin Thomas
text:
Gavin Michael Thomas (born 22 October 1977) is a former Welsh international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> <a href="Flanker%20%28rugby%20union%29">flanker</a>, who was capped more than 20 times for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>. He played his club rugby for <a href="Tondu%20RFC">Tondu</a>, <a href="Bridgend%20Ravens">Bridgend</a>, <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a>, the <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys</a>, the <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> and the <a href="Dragons%20%28rugby%20union%29">Newport Gwent Dragons</a>.
Thomas made his senior international debut for Wales on 10 June 2001 against <a href="Japan%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Japan</a>, and was capped on another six occasions that year. He then played in the <a href="2002%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2002 Six Nations</a>, as well as playing Tests against <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa</a> and <a href="Romania%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Romania</a>. He was capped six times in 2003, including the <a href="2003%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">Six Nations</a>. He played in two Tests against Argentina in June 2006.
In May 2010, he was added to the <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales national rugby union team</a> standby list for the summer matches and subsequently called into the full squad due to injury to <a href="Andy%20Powell%20%28rugby%20player%29">Andy Powell</a>. Thomas returned to the Wales starting lineup against in <a href="Dunedin">Dunedin</a> on 19 June 2010 after a four-year absence.
Thomas announced his retirement from rugby in June 2012.
